intro: Centaurea reflexa subsp. salonitana, commonly known as the Sicilian star-thistle, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features spiny, glandular stems and leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces bright purple to reddish flowers arranged in dense, spherical heads. It thrives in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the Asteraceae family.
